org.jgrapes.io.events

Class Read<T extends ManagedBuffer<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.core.internal.EventBase<T>
      • org.jgrapes.core.Event<T>
        • org.jgrapes.io.events.ConnectionEvent<java.lang.Void,DataConnection>
          • org.jgrapes.io.events.Read<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>, Matchable

    public class Read<T extends ManagedBuffer<?>>
extends ConnectionEvent<java.lang.Void,DataConnection>
    This event signals that a new chunk of data has successfully been obtained from some source. The data is kept in a buffer. If a buffer pool is passed to the event, the buffer is returned to the pool upon successful processing of the event.
    Author:
    Michael N. Lipp

      • Read

        public Read(DataConnection connection,
            T buffer)
        Create a new event with the given buffer.
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection that this data was received on and that can be used for sending Write events as replies
        buffer - the buffer with the data

      • handled

        protected void handled()
        Description copied from class: EventBase
        Invoked after all handlers for the event have been executed. May be overridden by derived classes to cause some immediate effect (instead of e.g. waiting for the completion event). The default implementation does nothing. This method is invoked by the event handler thread and must not block.
        Overrides:
        handled in class EventBase<java.lang.Void>
